intro: Ononis arragonensis, commonly known as Arragon's restharrow, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it is adapted to arid conditions. Ononis arragonensis plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local insect populations.
